question: I am in my early 30's and have been recently diagnosed with stage three chronic kidney disease and have type 1 diabetes.  I have already carried one healthy baby with these conditions, but I want him to have a brother or sister.  My diabetes is now in very tight control and, while my kidney function decresed during the pregnancy, it's back to where it was before we concieved our first child.  I'm afraid that if i wait to much longer my kidney disease will progree to where I wouldn't be able to carry another baby.  Some dr's have said it would be OK to try again and some have told me absolutly not.  Generally speaking, what are the chances our being able to have one more?  What are the risks to me or the baby?
title: what are the chances?
